visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render an area chart with the following specifications: Chart type: area, Chart title: 'Area Chart Example', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color for the title, a light gray color for the axis labels, and a larger font size for the title. Data series: Include one series named 'Data Series 1' with data points [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]. Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue to dark blue for the area fill. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray color, add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render an area chart with a title 'Area Chart Example'. The chart type is set to 'area', and the background color is a light gray (#f0f0f0). The title is styled with a dark blue color (#00008B) and a larger font size (20px). The axis labels are styled with a light gray color (#D3D3D3). The data series 'Data Series 1' contains points [1, 2, 3, 4, 5], and the area fill uses a gradient from light blue (#ADD8E6) to dark blue (#00008B). The legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart, centered horizontally. The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides to provide ample space around the chart.
